result.execSummary:
The defendant Wesley T. Hale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Wesley T. Hale
parties.address: W1351 Maureen Ct., Lake Geneva, WI 53147

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Agent may request early termination of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------

Maintain full time employment or school.
------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATIONS OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
------------------------

timeConds.notes:
The defendant is to complete eighty (80) hours of community service work during each year of probation for a total of 240 hours - No buyout and hours are to be completed in Walworth County.
----------------------------------
*AMENDMENT 11-11-2015 - CONDITIONS OF PROBATION MODIFIED so that the defendant can perform his community service work in either Walworth County or Door County.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Wesley T. Hale in court with attorney Mick H Sellergren.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Defendant Wesley T. Hale in court with attorney Mick H Sellergren.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Motion hearing on April 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on April 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
State's Brief to the Court to Admit Expert Testimony of Sergeant Jeff Patek
Notice of Motion & Motion to Exclude State's Experrt Testimony

Attorney Mick H Sellergren appeared.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Wesley T. Hale in court with attorney Mick H Sellergren.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Wesley T. Hale in court with attorney Mick H Sellergren. Andrew Herrmann under the supervision of ADA Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 3:47 p.m. State calls Jeffry Spotz who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of Andrew Herrmann. State's Exhibit S-1 marked and identified (copy of criminal complaint). State moves exhibit into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received.
3:51 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Sellegren
3:52 p.m. - Redirect by Mr. Herrmann
3:52 p.m. - Re-cross by Attorney Sellergren
3:53 p.m. - Witness excused. No other witnesses. Evidence closed.
3:54 p.m. - Argument by Andrew Herrmann
3:54 p.m. - Argument by Attorney Sellergren. Attorney Sellergen requests complaint be amended to simple possession.
3:56 p.m. - Response by the Court. Court finds finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the defendant over.
Information filed.
Matter proceeds to arraignment. Defendant enters not guilty plea and reserves right to jury trial.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Wesley T. Hale in court with attorney Mick H Sellergren.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary heraing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
